Exaggerate: The claim may be exaggerating Romney's stance on gay adoption by suggesting that he would deny gay people the right to adopt children.
Lack enough support: The claim does not provide sufficient evidence to support the assertion that Romney would deny gay people the right to adopt children.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that Romney's opposition to gay marriage automatically translates to opposition to gay adoption, which may not be a valid assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations for Romney's opposition to gay marriage that do not necessarily imply a denial of the right to adopt children.
